CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant owns a flat in GPE . Based on a construction permit issued by GPE on DATE , construction works were commenced on neighbouring land to build an apartment block . The limitations concerning the height of the building were not respected and , as a result , the sea view from the applicant ’s flat , which is situated on the sixth floor , was blocked by the new building .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant initiated administrative proceedings against GPE for the annulment of the construction permit . He maintained that the permit was in breach of city planning regulations . On DATE ORG found in the applicant ’s favour and annulled the construction permit . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant asked GPE to enforce the decision of ORG , but his request was rejected .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated compensation proceedings before ORG on account of the GPE ’s failure to implement the court order of CARDINAL DATE . He requested both pecuniary and non - pecuniary compensation , stating that the non - enforcement of the final court decision which had annulled the construction permit had diminished his flat ’s value .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially upheld the applicant ’s claim , awarding him pecuniary compensation , but refusing non - pecuniary damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision in respect of pecuniary damage . However , finding that the applicant was also entitled to non - pecuniary compensation , it quashed the judgment in this respect . Subsequent to this decision , the Municipality paid the pecuniary compensation to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG awarded MONEY ( GPE ) to the applicant in respect of non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE , considering the amount of non - pecuniary compensation insufficient , ORG quashed the judgment of ORG once again .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG insisted on maintaining its judgment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adhered to the decision of ORG and awarded the applicant GPE CARDINAL in respect of non - pecuniary compensation with statutory interest running from DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal of the Municipality . The Municipality paid the due amount to the applicant .
